paper_abstract: We use computational phylogenetic techniques to solve a central problem in inferential network monitoring More precisely, we design a novel algorithm for multicast-based delay inference, that is. the problem of reconstructing delay characteristics of a network from end-to-end delay measurements on network paths Our inference algorithm is based on additive metric techniques used in phylogenetics It runs in polynomial time and,requires a sample of size only poly(log a) We also show how to recover the topology of the routine tree (C) 2010 Wiley Periodicals. Inc Random Struct Alg .37. 176-203. 2010
paper_title: Network Delay Inference from Additive Metrics
